info.description: Community management API with Kafka event processing
info.title: Gommunity API

post.description: Create a new community (only for ROLE_TEACHER and ROLE_ADMIN)

get.description: Get all communities owned by the authenticated user
Retrieves posts published inside a community.

post.description: Members can create messages while admins or owners can also create announcements.

get.description: Retrieves a post using its identifier within a community.

delete.description: Only community admins or owners can delete posts.

get.description: Get a specific community by its ID

put.description: Update community name, description, icon and banner (only owner can update)

delete.description: Delete a community (only owner can delete)

patch.description: Update the privacy status of a community (only owner can update)

get.description: Retrieves announcements from all communities the user is subscribed to

post.description: Allows a user to add a reaction to a post. If the user already reacted, the reaction type will be updated.
post.summary: Add or update a reaction to a post

delete.description: Allows a user to remove their reaction from a post.
delete.summary: Remove a reaction from a post

get.description: Retrieves aggregated reaction counts grouped by reaction type for a specific post.
get.summary: Get reaction counts for a post

get.description: Retrieves the authenticated user's reaction on a specific post.
get.summary: Get current user's reaction on a post

post.description: Subscribe a user to a community with a specific role. IMPORTANT: Self-subscriptions (following a community) always receive 'member' role regardless of requested role. In public communities, users can only subscribe themselves. In private communities, owner/admin can add users by username and assign any role.
post.summary: Subscribe a user to a community

delete.description: Remove a user's subscription from a community. Users can unsubscribe themselves, or owner/admin can remove users.
delete.summary: Unsubscribe a user from a community

get.description: Get all subscriptions for a specific community with optional pagination
get.summary: Get all subscriptions for a community

get.description: Get the total number of subscriptions for a specific community
get.summary: Get subscription count for a community

get.description: Get a specific subscription for a user in a community
get.summary: Get subscription by user and community

get.description: Get a specific user by their username
Get a specific user by their user ID

put.description: Update the banner URL for the authenticated user
